item.title: Report X-2023100611
item.description:
Report X-2023100611

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-30
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was removed from sort due to a small wet spot on the top of the carton. It was brought to the HWPA for inspection. DescribePack: One of the three bottles leaked at the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The carton was inspected, and the leak was determined to be minor, less than one ounce, and was confined to the carton.

item.title: Report X-2023100601
item.description:
Report X-2023100601

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: One of four 1-gallon bottles had a loose cap, resulting in leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023100028
item.description:
Report X-2023100028

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered during loading of the Aircraft emitting an odor. The box contained four 1L glass bottles of Gasoline. One of the bottles had a cracked lid, all of contents leaked out. The bottle was in a black plastic bag full of absorbent material, which contained the leak from reaching the outer box. The shipment was placed into a Steel Salvage Package. The shipper will be contacted for further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023091113
item.description:
Report X-2023091113

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: INSPECTED SEVEN AIR PACKAGES DUE TO THERMAL LABELS STATING T4 FUEL. ONE BOX ALSO MARKED "ALL FUEL HAS BEEN REPLACED WITH NEW FUEL". THERE ARE PREVIOUS LTD QTY GROUND MARKINGS THAT HAVE MOSTLY BEEN REMOVED ON FIVE OF THE BOXES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TRACKING NUMBER 1Z3888E40293790410 CONTAINED ONE RAMSET COMPACT TOOL KIT WITH TWO LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED IN THE CASE. 1Z3888E40292508003 CONTAINED ONE RAMSET COMPACT TOOL KIT WITH TWO LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED IN THE CASE ALONG WITH TWENTY UN1950, 2.1, FLAMMABLE AEROSOL FUEL CELLS. TRACKING NUMBERS 1Z3888E40290258420, 1Z3888E40293895245, 1Z3888E40293906465, 1Z3888E40291608031 AND 1Z3888E40292136058 EACH CONTAINED ONE UN1950, 2.1, FLAMMABLE AEROSOL FUEL CELLS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of events unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to metal can of contents failing from being dropped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open contents bin and leaving it for OB QA to process.

item.title: Report X-2023100330
item.description:
Report X-2023100330

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin discovered a wet fiberboard box without diamond label, UN number, or proper shipping name on HMPA staging pallet in a tote. DescribePack: One of three 7.3oz metal aerosol cans depressurized and lost all fluid due to inadequate preparation for transport; no internal partitions or covers for the aerosol valve mechanism found. Unsecured valve stems freely released gas and fluid when box put under the (not excessive) weight of other packages. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, all spillage absorbed, and ventilation used.

Report X-2023100276

  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX WAS LYING ON ITS SIDE ON THE QA TABLE. PACKAGE WAS PLACED UPRIGHT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION, ITS NOTED THAT 3 OF THE CAPS WERE NOT SECURELY TIGHTENED WHICH RESULTED IN THE LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: TIGHTENING THE CAPS

item.title: Report X-2023100267
item.description:
Report X-2023100267

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Fully regulated hazmat in wet fiberboard box discovered on loadside and relabeled by ops admin. All spillage and packaging contained in a lined tote and transported to HMPA for reporting. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.6 gallon of fluid due to a loose cap closure. Threads may be worn; spillage cannot be stoppered when bottle is tilted to side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used. Tote used to transport material to HMPA was lined with hazbag.

item.title: Report X-2023100256
item.description:
Report X-2023100256

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking and wet at the bottom. Crack was found at the bottom. Bottle being placed on the side keeps leaking from continuing. DescribePack: Crack. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bottle was placed in a hazmat bag and keep on its side so crack is facing upwards.

item.title: Report X-2023090794
item.description:
Report X-2023090794

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was presented to a Memphis spill agent. The box contained 4 small paint cans, fiberboard dividers, and Styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. Each can was individually enclosed in a single clear plastic bag. Each bag was sealed via bag tie. Each can had ring locks for positive closure. 1 of the 4 cans was dented inward on one side allowing the loss of contents from the top lid. Contact Shipper for disposition. An amended Shipper's Declaration is needed for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023090754
item.description:
Report X-2023090754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of release at the Memphis Hub. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans with positive closure rings and fiberboard dividers. One of the cans had a damaged bottom chime causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023090692
item.description:
Report X-2023090692

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: CORDOVA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Sept 8th during the sort process a package was found with an odor and a small leak on the corner of the package. The package contained 2 cans of UN1866, Resin Solution, 3, III. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and returned to the shipper after receiving an amended shippers declaration .

item.title: Report X-2023082083
item.description:
Report X-2023082083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to an outbound operation for a fiberboard box that was hot to the touch . This package was labeled as a UN3481. While investigating the package the agent observed that on of the cellphones inside was extremely warm and the back appeared to be melting. The one cellphone was separated from the other and they were placed into a steel salvage package.
